headline.main: OUR STEAM NAVY.; Notes on the United States Sloop-of-War and Auxiliary Steamship Brooklyn--Account of her Performance--Her Faults--Her Success--Superiority of this Species of Craft for Government Purposes.

docs.lead_paragraph: This morning the Brooklyn, Capt. FARRAGUT, with the American Legation on board, took her departure from Vera Cruz for a point on tile Gulf 75 miles below, from which point Mr. MOLANE proposed to proceed to San Andres Tuxtia, some thirty miles in the interior. Being desirous of reaching Minatit??an, your correspondent availed himself of the kind invitation of Capt. FARRAGUT to take passage on the Brooklyn on the above mentioned occasion.

docs.snippet: The Commissioners of Health did a wise thing yesterday. The City Inspector stated that a great many dead animals were lying in the streets, through the neglect of the offal contractors. Whereupon the Commissioners directed Mr. DELAVAN himself to see...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health did a wise thing yesterday. The City Inspector stated that a great many dead animals were lying in the streets, through the neglect of the offal contractors. Whereupon the Commissioners directed Mr. DELAVAN himself to see the carcases removed, the expenses to be paid by the Comptroller, and charged to the contractors.

docs.snippet: On Saturday afternoon a new step was taken in the progress of the Central Park. This noble work, which is so clearly destined to be the honor and delight of New-York, has now received the "consecration of tones."
docs.lead_paragraph: On Saturday afternoon a new step was taken in the progress of the Central Park. This noble work, which is so clearly destined to be the honor and delight of New-York, has now received the "consecration of tones."

headline.main: The Oberlin Rescuers-Their Reception at Home.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Oberlin Rescuers, released from prison, took the first train for their homes. According to a six column report in the Cleveland Plaindealer, the wives and little ones, the great men of the village o Oberlin, the strangers within its gates, and all the neighborhood, vied with each other (June 6) i.e doing honor to the " martyrs.

docs.snippet: MORTALITY.--Dr. BOYD, Health Officer, reports 121 deaths for the week ending Saturday last. Although this is about a fair average of deaths for this season of the year, physicians and druggists are unanimous in their opinions that the City is...
docs.lead_paragraph: MORTALITY.--Dr. BOYD, Health Officer, reports 121 deaths for the week ending Saturday last. Although this is about a fair average of deaths for this season of the year, physicians and druggists are unanimous in their opinions that the City is unusually healthy. The druggists say that their business is one-half less now than last year at this time.

docs.snippet: Whoever will pause, this morning, on his walk to business, along any of the streets that are shaded with old trees, will see trunks gay with white killers. In Brooklyn, especially, the crop is plenty, and if there is a breeze stirring, the sidewalks...
docs.lead_paragraph: Whoever will pause, this morning, on his walk to business, along any of the streets that are shaded with old trees, will see trunks gay with white killers. In Brooklyn, especially, the crop is plenty, and if there is a breeze stirring, the sidewalks look as if dotted with great snow-flakes.

headline.main: Commissioners of Heath.; THE CASE OF THE JOHN BOYNTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health met yesterday at 12 o'clock, present all the members. Dr. GUNN called the attention of the Board to the case of the brig John Boynton, which arrived from Port-au Prince about a week since; the Captain of which (Capt. Wm. Blye) died yesterday at his residence in Brooklyn, as reported of yellow fever.

headline.main: EUROPEAN AFFAIRS.; The London Press on the Position of Prussia. Further Extracts from our Files by the Asia.

docs.lead_paragraph: To a future generation of Englishmen it will seem inconceivable that, much as we sympathized, as a people, with the great Italian cause, we did not more deeply appreciate the mighty moments in which we now live. In the Cabinet and on the field all is equally in suspense.
